Job Description 123: BiSOFT is a leader in providing IT services to Corporate as well as Government clients. We believe in authenticity, hard work, and collaboration. Our motto is to be the best in whatever we do. If you are looking for a challenging work environment and a growth-oriented employer, you have come to the right place. Manual Tester Job Description : Experience in manual testing the Front end/ UI of Web Applications with complex workflows/complex software’s. Some experience in any programming languages is required. Ability to read code/Code reviews is required. Should have the ability to Read Test code and execute the test code. Regression testing. Experience in manual testing any CRM, ERP, or any complex Web Software applications. Experience in any scripting language (Ruby or python or capybara). In this position you will be testing our public and private websites, processes, new product launches and internal tools related to our products Bi-Pay, Bi-Grocery, and Bestaurant. Requirements : 4 Year Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline with 5 years of experience. Alternatively, a Master’s degree with 3 years of experience. Salary: $60,000.00/year Job Location: Redmond, WA How to Apply: Please email your updated resume and cover letter along with your current and expected salary to cv@bisoftllc.com.
Job Description 124: We are seeking a skilled Technical Project Manager with expertise in AI, LLM, and NLP technologies, including strong proficiency in Node.js, Python, and JavaScript. As the Project Manager, you will play a pivotal role in leading complex AI/NLP/LLM projects, including Text-to-Speech integration. Your technical acumen and experience will be instrumental in delivering innovative solutions that transform language processing and user interactions. Responsibilities: 1. Project Planning: Define project scope, objectives, and timelines. Create detailed plans for efficient project execution. 2. Technical Expertise: Understand AI, LLM, and NLP requirements. Communicate effectively with technical teams in Node.js, Python, and JavaScript. 3. Cross-Functional Coordination: Facilitate collaboration between business leaders, developers, and engineers. 4. Text-to-Speech Integration: Lead the seamless integration of Text-to-Speech functionality into applications. 5. Risk Management: Identify and mitigate potential risks and bottlenecks. 6. Budget & Resource Management: Ensure optimal allocation for successful project outcomes. 7. Stakeholder Communication: Regularly update stakeholders on project progress and outcomes. 8. Quality Assurance: Ensure high-quality deliverables aligned with project goals. 9. Agile Methodology: Implement Agile practices for efficient project management. 10. Continuous Improvement: Optimize processes for enhanced efficiency. Qualifications: 1. Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or related field. 2. Experience: Minimum 5 years in technical project management. 3. Technical Knowledge: Proficiency in Node.js, Python, JavaScript, and Text-to-Speech integration. 4. Project Management Skills: Track record of managing complex AI projects successfully. 5. Communication: Excellent communication and leadership abilities. 6. Analytical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills. 7. Adaptability: Thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Join our innovative team as a Technical Project Manager in the AI, LLM, and NLP space, with a focus on Text-to-Speech integration. Apply now to lead groundbreaking projects that redefine language processing and user experiences. Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Experience level: 5 years Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Application Question(s): Are you proficient in Node.js, Python, JavaScript, and Text-to-Speech integration? Work Location: In person
Job Description 125: Amex GBT is a place where colleagues find inspiration in travel as a force for good and – through their work – can make an impact on our industry. We’re here to help our colleagues achieve success and offer an inclusive and collaborative culture where your voice is valued. Ready to explore a career path? Start your journey. Sr. Software Developer wanted by American Express Global Business Travel, Egencia in Bellevue, WA. Lead the end-to-end software development lifecycle, from requirements gathering and design to implementation, testing, and deployment; Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of software components and contribute to the overall architecture and design decisions; Provide technical expertise and guidance to the development team, mentor junior engineers, and promote a culture of continuous learning and improvement; Conduct code reviews and maintain code quality by implementing appropriate testing methodologies, code refactoring, and performance optimization techniques; Identify and address technical challenges and bottlenecks, proposing innovative solutions and ensuring timely delivery of high-quality software products; Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, industry trends, and best practices, and assess their applicability to improve our software development processes and products; Participate in agile development methodologies and actively contribute to sprint planning, backlog grooming, and other team activities. Must have a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or related field plus five (5) years of experience in any occupation which includes the required experience/skills. Must have five (5) years of experience with Programming Languages: Java, Python and SQL; five (5) years of experience with GIT and Jenkins; five (5) years of experience with JIRA and Confluence; five (5) years of experience with Kibana, DataDog and PagerDuty; four (4) years of experience with Databases: DynamoDB and MongoDB; and three (3) years of experience with AWS Tools: Redis, Kinesis and S3. May work from home within commuting distance to office. Salary range: $182,312-$203,000/yr. #LI-DNI Location Washington - MidStation Bellevue The #TeamGBT Experience Work and life: Find your happy medium at Amex GBT. Flexible benefits are tailored to each country and start the day you do. These include health and welfare insurance plans, retirement programs, parental leave, adoption assistance, and more. Travel perks: get a choice of deals each week from major travel providers on everything from flights to hotels to cruises and car rentals. Develop the skills you want when the time is right for you, with global tuition assistance, access to over 20,000 courses on our learning platform, leadership courses, and new job openings available to internal candidates first. We strive to champion Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion in every aspect of our business at GBT. You can connect with colleagues through our global Inclusion Groups, centered around common identities or initiatives, to discuss challenges, obstacles, achievements, and drive company awareness and action. Wellbeing resources to support mental and emotional health for you and your immediate family. And much more! All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to age, gender identity (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, disability, veteran status, citizenship or marital status. It is our policy to maintain an equal-opportunity environment free from intimidation, harassment or bias for our candidates, colleagues, clients and suppliers.
